description: Commentary Anti-Israel demonstrations began sprouting up across North America within days of the terrorist attack upon Israel on Oct. 7, 2023. The demonstrations were initially large, and many demonstrators claimed they were seeking to promote peace in the Middle East. They continually told us they wanted to encourage a two-state solution and wanted what was […]
title: Cory Morgan: Feds Must Crack Down on Extremist Anti-Israel Protests on Canadian Streets

description: Nearly 60,000 mobile phones will not connect to triple-zero when the 3G network shuts down, as telcos continue urging customers to upgrade their technology. Telstra and Optus will close the ageing mobile network from Oct. 28, having delayed their earlier deadlines to launch a public safety campaign. A Senate inquiry in July confirmed thousands of […]
title: Thousands of Aussies yet to Upgrade as 3G Closure Looms

description: Foreign Affairs Minister Mélanie Joly was not briefed on foreign interference conducted by China as she was attempting to rebuild ties with the country, the Foreign Interference Commission heard. “I was appointed after the return of the two Michaels to Canada, that’s important to understand, because my work is to re-establish a functional relationship with […]
title: Minister Joly Was Tasked to Rebuild China Ties, but Wasn’t Briefed on Its Foreign Interference

description: China’s stock market plunged on Oct. 9, after a sharp rise in late September induced by the Chinese communist regime’s stimulus policies. The indexes of China’s three major exchanges: Beijing, Shanghai, and Shenzhen, continued to fluctuate on Oct. 10. China’s benchmark CSI 300 index—the top 300 stocks traded on the Shanghai Stock Exchange and the […]
title: China’s Stock Market Tumbles, Raising Doubts About CCP’s Stimulus: Experts

description: Most Canadians agree that a 15 percent tip for good service at restaurants is acceptable, but they diverge on which other services warrant a tip, according to a recent survey. The online survey, conducted by Narrative Research, studied which circumstances Canadians felt it was “acceptable” to tip. It also identified which situations tips were regarded […]
title: Which Services Canadians Say Deserve a Tip—and Which Don’t

description: The secretary of state reaffirmed U.S. commitment to uphold freedom of navigation, and warned Beijing against aggression toward Taiwan.
title: Blinken: US Concerned Over Beijing’s ‘Dangerous and Unlawful Actions’ in South China Sea

description: Indonesia’s communications minister said on Oct. 11 that the nation had asked Google and Apple to block Temu from their app stores in a bid to protect small businesses. Temu, a China-based, ultra-low-price e-commerce app, currently operates in only a few Southeast Asian countries. Globally, it’s available in 79 countries. According to a Momentum Works report, its […]
title: Indonesia Asks Apple, Google to Block Temu

description: Presidential candidates Harris and Trump diverge significantly on how to end the war in Ukraine, and whether to negotiate with Russia at all.
title: Where Harris and Trump Stand on Ukraine

description: An Australian court ruled in favor of X, overturning an eSafety commissioner's order to block video footage of an attack on Bishop Mar Mari Emmanuel in April.
title: Australian Court Sides with X in Free Speech Battle

description: Following the NDP’s pharmacare bill becoming law on Oct. 10, Leader Jagmeet Singh is calling for the Liberal government to quickly sign agreements with the provinces to implement the program. “I’m letting Justin Trudeau know right now, I’m letting the government know… don’t drag your feet when it comes to negotiations,” Singh told reporters in […]
title: NDP Pushes Liberals to Make Deals With Provinces After Pharmacare Bill Becomes Law

description: Defence Minister Bill Blair said he’s unaware what caused a delay in his approval of a warrant application to surveil an Ontario politician while Blair was minister of public safety. The Foreign Interference Commission heard in recent days that CSIS had submitted its warrant 54 days prior to when it was finally signed off by […]
title: Minister Blair Says Unaware Why Warrant on Ontario Politician Was Delayed

description: Israeli military says Hezbollah operates from within and near civilian areas in southern Lebanon, including areas near U.N. posts.
title: 2 More UN Peacekeepers Injured as Israel Fires at Hezbollah in the Area

description: Money laundering penalties levied against Toronto-Dominion Bank this week by U.S. regulators could be a drag on the bank’s stock price long-term, analysts warn. On Thursday, TD agreed to pay fines totalling about US$3.09 billion after pleading guilty to multiple charges related to failings in the bank’s anti-money laundering program. The bank is now the […]
title: TD Money Laundering Fines Could Weigh on Bank’s Stock Long-Term, Analysts Warn

description: Spotify is raising its prices again in Canada. The music streaming service notified users this week that it will increase the cost of its ad-free monthly subscription packages before the end of the year. Individual accounts are going up by $1.70 per month to $12.69 before taxes, while Spotify’s popular family accounts—which allow up to […]
title: Spotify Plans to Raise Prices on Its Monthly Streaming Packages in Canada

description: Stéphan Perreault and his team have been helping restore power in North Carolina since Hurricane Helene hit in late September, and they don’t expect to be heading home any time soon. They are some of the hundreds—possibly thousands—of Canadian line workers who have been called into service to help rebuild power grids after Helene and […]
title: Gruelling Days and Gratitude for Canadian Line Workers Helping With Hurricane Outages

description: Police say they’ve arrested two suspects in an Old Montreal fire last week that claimed the lives of two French nationals. Léonor Geraudie, 43, and seven-year-old Vérane Reynaud Geraudie, were identified by authorities as the victims of the Oct. 4 blaze on Notre-Dame Street East. Police said that when fire broke out there were 25 […]
title: Two Suspects Arrested in Old Montreal Fire That Killed Mother, Daughter

description: Two Canadians have gained international acclaim for their stunning photography featuring wildlife scenes from British Columbia and the Yukon. Shane Gross, a marine conservation photojournalist based in B.C., was named Wildlife Photographer of the Year 2024 during an awards ceremony hosted by the UK Natural History Museum on October 8. He received the distinction for […]
title: ‘Captivated’: Canadians Win Prestigious Wildlife Photography Awards

description: Seven Vancouver police officers involved in the beating death of Myles Gray nine years ago have been cleared of wrongdoing by a police discipline authority. The Office of the Police Complaints Commissioner said it was reviewing the decision over the 2015 death of Gray, which was classified as a homicide by a coroner’s inquest last […]
title: Police Probe Clears Seven Vancouver Officers in Beating Death of Myles Gray

description: Former U.S. President Donald Trump has announced plans to renegotiate the United States-Mexico-Canada free trade agreement (USMCA) if he wins the U.S. presidential election in November. “Upon taking office, I will formally notify Mexico and Canada of my intention to invoke the six-year renegotiation provisions of the USMCA that I put in,” Trump announced in […]
title: Trump Pledges to Renegotiate Free Trade Deal With Canada and Mexico If Elected

description: The Office for National Statistics said GDP rose slightly in August, as the chancellor prepares for upcoming Budget following warnings of 'unpopular decisions.'
title: Economy Grew in August, Figures Show

description: The Iranian-backed Houthis claimed responsibility and said they also targeted a vessel in the Indian Ocean with ‘a winged missile.’
title: Houthis Strike Liberian-Flagged Tanker in Red Sea With Missiles

description: A woman from Montreal’s South Shore has been charged with aggravated assault after allegedly splashing a 10-year-old boy with boiling water. Longueuil, Que., police this morning arrested Stéphanie Borel, 46, who is alleged to have seriously injured the boy on Oct. 2. Borel was first arrested immediately after the incident, which occurred outside a residence […]
title: Longueuil Woman Charged After 10-Year-Old Boy Scalded With Boiling Water

description: The European Court of Auditors said the rise was largely due to errors made in the spending of EU cash handed out to bolster development in poorer regions.
title: Auditors Say Erroneous EU Spending Has Become a ‘Concerning Trend’

description: OTTAWA—Canadian firms are still seeing weak demand and slow sales growth but conditions improved marginally in the third quarter and could be boosted by rate cuts, according to a Bank of Canada survey released on Friday. Over the next 12 months, 43 percent of businesses expect the rate of increase in sales volumes to be […]
title: Canadian Firms See Sluggish Conditions, Hope Rate Cuts Will Boost Demand: BoC Survey

description: Prosecutors plan Google break-up; Trump turns down proposal for second debate; and T.D. Bank accepts historic $3 billion money laundering fine.
title: America in Brief

description: More women have come forward to allege they were victims of the late Harrods owner and his associates in wake of TV documentary, police said.
title: 40 Fresh Al Fayed Allegations Under Investigation

description: Commentary In September, Alberta Premier Danielle Smith announced that the right to make one’s own choices about receiving vaccinations should be added to the Alberta Bill of Rights, stating: “No Albertan should ever be subjected or pressured into accepting a medical treatment without their full consent.” Some argue that new laws to protect the right […]
title: John Carpay: Canadians Need Legislation to Protect Their Rights

description: Gross domestic product is now predicted to shrink by 0.2 percent this year, slightly less than the 0.3 percent it shrank in 2023.
title: German Economy Set to Shrink for 2nd Year Running

description: Two Canadian families who lost relatives in the 2023 Hamas attack in Israel are suing Iran, Syria, Hamas, and other organizations, for $350 million. The lawsuit, filed in the Ontario Superior Court of Justice, is being brought under the Justice for Victims of Terrorism Act, which allows supporters of terrorism to be sued for damages […]
title: Canadian Families of Oct. 7 Victims Sue Iran, Hamas, Others for $350 Million

description: Commentary In response to Canada’s 100 percent tariff on Chinese-produced electric vehicles (EVs), and our 25 percent tariff on Chinese-manufactured steel and aluminum, China announced it would launch an anti-dumping investigation into Canadian canola imports. The trouble with China’s latest claim that a Western country is engaged in unfair trade practices is the many times […]
title: Canada Can Emerge Triumphant From Trade Wars With China

description: Canada needs to keep up its presence in Southeast Asia if it wants to benefit from the region’s economic boom, Prime Minister Justin Trudeau said on Friday as he wrapped up his visit to Laos. Trudeau participated in the Association of Southeast Asian Nations Summit this week, marking the third consecutive time he’s attended the […]
title: As ASEAN Summit Wraps, Trudeau Says Canada Needs to Keep Showing up in Southeast Asia

description: An estimated 28 people were killed in the strike in the Gaza Strip. Israel says its enemies hide weapons and activities in schools, hospitals, and homes.
title: Israel Says School Targeted as Hamas Command Center

description: France's Finance Minister Antoine Armand said that belt-tightening budget is meant to regain control over its 'spiraling' debt burden.
title: French Government Announces 60 Billion Euro Spending Cuts and Tax Hikes to Tackle Deficit

description: Brig. Gen. Rasoul Sanaei-Rad said that if Israel were to attack an Iranian nuclear facility, it would be 'crossing regional and global red lines.'
title: Iran Hints at Changing Nuclear Doctrine If Israel Attacks

description: Lawyers write to government to claim it is in breach of law around religious discrimination with proposed tax as no alternative state provision exists.
title: Private Religious Schools Take Legal Action Over VAT Plans

description: Shippers are calling on Ottawa to better protect supply chains from labour disruptions. In a letter to the federal government, executives from 10 industry groups are demanding that officials take action to ease the threat of work stoppages at key transport hubs and arteries. The organizations, which range from the Chamber of Marine Commerce to […]
title: Shippers Call on Feds to Protect Supply Chains Against Labour Disruptions

description: Former public safety minister Bill Blair is expected to face questions at a federal inquiry today about why it took much longer than usual to sign off on a spy service warrant in 2021. A commission of inquiry into foreign interference has heard that it took 54 days for the Canadian Security Intelligence Service warrant […]
title: Former Public Safety Minister Bill Blair Expected to Face Questions About Spy Warrant

description: The economy added 47,000 jobs in September, while the unemployment rate declined for the first time since January to 6.5 percent. Statistics Canada says youth and women aged 25 to 54 drove employment gains last month, while full-time employment saw its largest gain since May 2022. Despite the job gains, the employment rate was lower […]
title: Economy Adds 47,000 Jobs in September, Unemployment Rate Falls to 6.5 Percent

description: MADRID—Spanish scientists said they will reveal details of the nationality of 15th-century explorer Christopher Columbus on Saturday, after using DNA analysis to tackle a centuries-old mystery. Countries have argued over the origins and the final resting place of the divisive figure who led Spanish-funded expeditions from the 1490s onward, opening the way for the European […]
title: Spanish Scientists to Shed Light on Mystery of Columbus Origins, Burial

description: The Nobel Peace Prize was awarded Friday to Nihon Hidankyo, a Japanese organization of survivors of the U.S. atomic bombings of Hiroshima and Nagasaki, for its activism against nuclear weapons. Jørgen Watne Frydnes, chair of the Norwegian Nobel Committee, said the award was made as the “taboo against the use of nuclear weapon is under […]
title: Nobel Peace Prize Awarded to Japanese Organization of Atomic Bombing Survivors Nihon Hidankyo

description: The latest estimates come as Russian forces advanced on towns in the eastern Donetsk region.
title: Pentagon Puts Russian Casualties in Ukraine War at 600,000

description: The second day of a joint social media summit has kicked into gear, prompting discussions on how parents navigate the online realm and what rules could come.
title: Social Media Ban Punishments Won’t Fall on Children or Parents, Says Minister

description: The Bill will now be considered in the Senate.
title: Government’s $3 Billion Student Debt Reduction Bill Clears Lower House

description: Australia's shadow foreign minister supports the move to reinvigorate trade with Beijing, but says the nation must maintain its principles.
title: Shadow Foreign Minister Says China Trade Welcome, but Values Still Important

description: The pharmacare bill that was central to the now-disbanded Liberal-NDP agreement has officially become law, receiving royal assent on Oct. 10 after passing through the Senate without any amendments. The law, previously known as Bill C-64, will guide the development of future national universal pharmacare plans. It will enable the government to negotiate agreements with […]
title: Pharmacare Bill for Diabetes and Birth Control Medications Becomes Law

description: CTV News vice-president Richard Gray told MPs that a recent video broadcast by the news outlet misrepresenting comments from the opposition leader was an unprecedented occurrence in his 33-year career. Gray testified before the House of Commons ethics committee regarding a Sept. 22 video that was edited in a way that gave the impression that […]
title: CTV News VP Answers MPs’ Questions on Edited Poilievre Video

description: Deputy Premier Prue Car stated that the reforms strengthen the existing bail system.

description: Though the public view of China broadly follows that of the government in each Five Eyes country, there are significant differences in the detail, a study finds
title: American Public Not as Concerned About Beijing Compared to Five Eyes’ Allies

description: Quebec has introduced legislation to restrict the number of international students allowed to study in the province. Bill 74, “An Act Mainly to Improve the Regulatory Scheme Governing International Students,” was presented in the legislature Oct. 10 by Immigration, Francization and Integration Minister Jean-François Roberge. Foreign student numbers have surged from 50,000 in 2015 to […]
title: Quebec Bill Aims to Restrict the Number of International Students in the Province

description: A look into the world through the lens of photography.

description: Lack of success in finding the right partner and rising costs are among the main reasons Canadians are waiting to have children or not having any at all, a new poll suggests. Half of Canadians who would like to become parents say they have delayed it longer than they would like, according to an Oct. […]
title: The Reasons Behind Canada’s ‘Birth Rate Crisis,’ From Canadians Themselves
